goal:
Invest Europe is the association representing Europe’s private equity, venture capital and infrastructure sectors, as well as their investors.

Our membership covers the full range of private equity activity, from early-stage venture capital to the largest private equity firms, as well as funds investing in infrastructure. We also represent professional investors into these asset classes such as pension funds and insurance companies and have associate members from related professions. In total, the association is composed of 700 member firms and 500 affiliate members.


Invest Europe aims to make a constructive contribution to the policy debate at European level, helping its members to understand EU policy, and policymakers across the EU institutions to understand the impacts of those policies on investment in those companies backed by private equity and infrastructure investors.


Invest Europe is the guardian of the industry’s professional standards, demanding accountability, good governance and transparency from our members and spreading best practice through our training courses.


Our research provides authoritative data and analysis on trends and developments in our industry.


Invest Europe has 25 staff working in Brussels.
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Competition, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation
euInitiatives:
Invest Europe represents venture capital, private equity and infrastructure funds as well as institutions that invest in these funds. We support a competitive EU single market and a policy framework that is favourable to investment.

Invest Europe has a particular focus on policy issues that impact on fund managers' ability to invest into European companies but also that could impact on investors’ capacity to commit capital to our asset class. These include:

• Alternative investment fund managers (AIFM) - Directive 2011/61/EU
• European venture capital funds (EuVECA) - Regulation (EU) No 345/2013
• European long-term investment funds (ELTIFs) - Regulation (EU) 2015/760
• Financial conglomerates - Directive (2002/87/EC)
• Banking prudential requirements - Directive 2013/36/EU
• Banking prudential requirements - Regulation (EU) No 575/2013
• Key information documents for packaged retail and insurance-based investment products (PRIIPs) - Regulation (EU) No 1286/2014
• Markets in financial instruments (MiFID 2) - Directive 2014/65/EU
• Markets in financial instruments (MiFIR) - Regulation (EU) No 600/2014
• Prospectus - Regulation (EU) 2017/1129
• Market abuse - Regulation (EU) 596/2014
• Market abuse - Directive 2014/57/EU
• Derivatives (EMIR) - Regulation (EU) No 648/2012
• Risk management and supervision of insurance companies (Solvency 2) - Directive 2009/138/EC
• Institutions for occupational retirement provision (IORP) - Directive 2003/41/EC
• Accounting rules - Directive 2013/34/EU
• Insolvency Directive - 2012/30/EU
• International accounting standards - Regulation (EC) No 1606/2002
• Audit directive 2006/43/EC

Invest Europe also follows any EU initiatives regarding venture capital financing, including InvestEU and VentureEU.
